verses.verse: The burden <S%H4853><s%> of Damascus <S%H1834><s%>. Behold <S%H1834><s%>, Damascus is taken away <S%H5493><s%> from being a city <S%H5892><s%>, and it shall be a ruinous <S%H4654><s%> heap <S%H4596><s%>.

In that day <S%H3117><s%> shall men <S%H120><s%> look <S%H8159><s%> unto their Maker <S%H6213><s%>, and their eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall have respect <S%H7200><s%> to the Holy <S%H6918><s%> One of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

Ah <S%H1945><s%>, the uproar <S%H1995><s%> of many <S%H1995><s%> peoples <S%H5971><s%>, that roar <S%H1993><s%> like the roaring <S%H1993><s%> of the seas <S%H3220><s%>; and the rushing <S%H7588><s%> of nations <S%H3816><s%>, that rush like the rushing <S%H7582><s%> of mighty <S%H3524><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%>!

At eventide <S%H6256><s%>, behold <S%H1091><s%>, terror; and before the morning <S%H1242><s%> they are not <S%H2506><s%>. This is the portion of them that despoil <S%H8154><s%> us <S%H1486><s%>, and the lot of them that rob us <S%H962><s%>.
